ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] SHA2 certificate
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello Gina, I took a look at one of our archive-it instances of heritrix. It s using a certificate that heritrix generated automatically. I got the certificate

From: Noah Levitt <nlevitt@...>

Hello Gina,

I took a look at one of our archive-it instances of heritrix. =
It's
using a certificate that heritrix generated automatically. I got the
c=
ertificate using "openssl s_client -connect host:port", then used
"openssl =
x509 -text" to get more information about it. The full dump
is below. It te=
lls me the signature algorithm is
"sha256WithRSAEncryption". Sha256 is a ty=
pe of sha2 digest. So I guess
the answer to your question is _yes_. I'm cur=
ious what version of java
you're using that generates sha1-based certs, or =
if you have it
configured specially. Sha256 seems to be the default with op=
enjdk 7.

=
>
> With the deprecation of SH1 certs at the end of 2016, we need to valida=
te
> all of our HTTPS based application using SHA2 certs.
>

crawler is currently running under a SHA1 cert.
>
>
>
> Has anyone in the h=
eritrix community run heritrix under a SHA2 cert?
>
>
>
> Thanks

ones
